result.execSummary:
The defendant David A. Berube was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extradition costs $1,820 - check forwarded to ONSO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Sex with Child Age 16 or Older
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David A. Berube

defendant.name: Berube, David A.
defendant.address: L/k/a 117 Hamilton Street, Apt. 2C, Butte, MT 59701

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy of money order to Sheriff's Dept. for extradition costs

2:05 p.m. Defendant David A. Berube in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig speaks to resolution/agreement. State moves to amend Ct. 1 to s. 948.09, misdemeanor--speaks to restitution for out of pocket expenses; victim rights compliance. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty of 948.09. Michlig statement to sentencing--provides victim impact statement. Van Wagner/Berube statement to sentencing. Defendant to deposit $1,000 into attorney trust account as restitution to cover anticipated victim expenses over the next year; restitution hrg. w/in 1 yr. Court statement to sentencing/speaks to victim. Court to schedule review hrg. on restitution. 

Court sentence
40 days county jail-commence immediately
28 days' credit
$400 fine plus costs
Huber
Extradition costs $1,820 / check forwarded to ONSO
$1,000 deposited with defendant's attorney trust account 
DNA surcharge
Restitution to be determined
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery and State's Demand for Discovery
No contact with MJC, no contact with any female under age 18 except as necessary for work and then only supervised

1:28 pm Defendant David A. Berube in court, in custody, via video, with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived.
Michlig/Wagner to bail.  State submits to Court Exhibit 1 (police report) marked and received. Court sets $ cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
for production of physical evidence; demand for disclosure; motion for discovery of "other conduct" evidence; request for production of exculpatory evidence
Per Mary at ONSO - arrested in Flathead County, Montana - ONSO waiting for extradition to be waived
